channel.title: What do you think of the Mayans prediction?
channel.description:
Any mocking/"you're a retard" comment will be reported and ignored.
I'll start the ball rolling:
How can a civilisation that was around 6000 years ago manage to predict the exact date that the planets will be aligned [b]and[/b] one of the days when there will be the highest amount of solar sunspot activity.
And one more thing, has no one else noticed all of the: fish, crabs and birds mysteriously dying in huge numbers? And the floods in Australia? Think about it...

item.title: What do you think of the Mayans prediction?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:45, topic:377888”][quote author=`SJ_ link=topic=473772.msg3583209#msg3583209 date=1303951134]

There’s also a guy who thinks the world will end on 21th of may, this year. There’s always a group of morons who predict the world will end, the anti-christ will come, the Messias is (re-)born etc… None of these predictions are right, and the end of our planet will only be predicted by scientists when either the sun starts to fuck around or a extra-terrestrial object will crash into us.

The Sun would implode right? then we’d all freeze to death.

[/quote]
No, we will burn to death, or evaporate.[/quote]

no, it’s the rapture

the same guy also predicted the same thing for the 1990s

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think of the Mayans prediction?

item.description:

[quote="`SJ_, post:33, topic:377888"][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=473772.msg3576945#msg3576945 date=1303495684]

It’s going to be exactly like Y2K

Well, except that Y2K was actually a problem for many computer systems, and this isn’t anything at all.
[/quote]

Eh, didn’t they just update the system?[/quote]

Yeah they just updated the system central to every electronic device on the planet that was going to be vulnerable to the millennium bug.

Your comment sparked a question of interest, do people now (and I’m talking about people born after or just before the year 2000) think that everything is networked together o_O because anyone who lived in the '90s remembers this shit surely.

item.title: What do you think of the Mayans prediction?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

ranger squad:

But how did the day they pick to “end” their calender on magically coincide with the day on which all of the planets will be perfectly aligned?

Sources? Evidence? Oh! Oh no! Is this entire thread based off things you’ve “heard” ? How did you become so gullible… especially for taking it so seriously you insult anyone who calls you on your bullshit.

Stop wasting our time with nonsense.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think of the Mayans prediction?

item.title: What do you think of the Mayans prediction?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

ranger squad:

But how did the day they pick to “end” their calender on magically coincide with the day on which all of the planets will be perfectly aligned?

There is no planet alignment in 2012 or any other time in the next several decades. As to the Earth being in the center of the Milky Way, I don’t know what this phrase means. If you are referring to the Milky Way Galaxy, we are rather far toward the edge of this spiral galaxy, some 30,000 light years from the center. We circle the galactic center in a period of 225-250 million years, always keeping approximately the same distance. Concerning a pole shift, I also don’t know what this means. If it means some sudden change in the position of the pole (that is, the rotation axis of the Earth), then that is impossible, as noted in the answer to Question 10. What many websites do discuss is the alignment of the Earth and Sun with the center of the Milky Way in the constellation of Sagittarius. This happens every December, with no bad consequences, and there is no reason to expect 2012 to be different from any other year.

Source: http://astrobiology.nasa.gov/ask-an-astrobiologist/intro/nibiru-and-doomsday-2012-questions-and-answers

As stated in that Q&A, from a reliable source (instead of some idiotic conspiracy nut), there is no alignment. So get your head out of your arse and do some research before you believe some random idiot with no credentials other then from other random idiots.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think of the Mayans prediction?

item.title: What do you think of the Mayans prediction?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

ranger squad:

But how did the day they pick to “end” their calender on magically coincide with the day on which all of the planets will be perfectly aligned?

They probably based their calender off of astronomical events like that, so key points like the beginning and end would land on them.

Read full topic
